snippet: The Oratorio Society of New York performed Paul Moravec’s “ Blizzard Voices,” set to texts by the former poet laureate Ted Kooser and inspired by the deadly “Children’s Blizzard” of 1888.
abstract: Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim reviews performance by the Oratorio Society of New York, built around Paul Moravec work The Blizzard Voices, at Carnegie Hall.
lead_paragraph: The Oratorio Society of New York performed Paul Moravec’s “ Blizzard Voices,” set to texts by the former poet laureate Ted Kooser and inspired by the deadly “Children’s Blizzard” of 1888.

headline.seo: Oratorio Society of New York at Carnegie Hall
headline.main: Voices of a Deadly Blizzard, and Then Some Lullabies
headline.print_headline: Voices of a Deadly Blizzard, And Then Some Lullabies
